chess

Class Chess

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Chess

  • public class Chess
extends java.lang.Object
    This class drives the game logic for a Chess Match. It repeatedly redraws the game board and asks for input Until a checkmate condition is found.
    Author:
    Derek Schatel

      • Chess

        public Chess()

    • Method Detail

      • drawBoard

        public static void drawBoard()
        This method terates over the GameBoard object and draws the visual elements.

      • tokenizeInput

        public static void tokenizeInput()
        This method breaks down the user's input and handles it based on how many tokens it finds. If the tokens are valid RankFile tokens, it will retrieve their integer equivalents.

      • obtainCoords

        private static void obtainCoords(java.lang.String[] tokens)
        This is an umbrella method for obtaining the matrix row and column values based on the user's input
        Parameters:
        tokens - Array of Strings representing individual tokens

      • validateNum

        private static boolean validateNum(java.lang.String alpha)
        This method ensures that the File number passed from input is valid for the game board.
        Parameters:
        alpha - File number as a string
        Returns:
        boolean value for whether File number is valid

      • alphaToNum

        private static int alphaToNum(java.lang.String alpha)
        This method parses the Rank value passed from input.
        Parameters:
        alpha - String representing the Rank
        Returns:
        corresponding integer value for 2D array

      • promote

        public static void promote()
        This method handles pawn promotion. If a pawn has found its way into the outer rows, the method checks when the requested promotion type is and replaced the pawn with a new Object. Defaults to Queen if no promotion type selected.

      • movePiece

        public static void movePiece()
        Handles all logic related to moving pieces around the board. If the piece can legally move and if it can reach its destination, moves the piece, nulls out the original location's reference and swaps player turns.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
